event.title: was incorporated as a city as recently as 1927

data.event: Rincon, in the southeast area of Effingham County, was incorporated as a city as recently as 1927.
While the earliest settlers came to the area in 1751, its existence as a full-fledged community with families and businesses dates back to the late 19th century.
(Rinc√≥n means "corner.") Once the railroad and depot were built, a telegraph operator or agent is known to have been on duty as early as about 1895.

event.title: the railroad and service to Rincon and the combined availability of the "dirt" road (now

data.event: With the coming of the railroad and service to Rincon and the combined availability of the "dirt" road (now State Highway 21) between Savannah and Rincon and beyond, and other country roads between farms and the town and outlying other towns, Rincon became a small hive of activity.

event.title: wagoned" their products, cotton and lumber, to Savannah, now

data.event: The surrounding farmers, sawmill operators and the like, who "wagoned" their products, cotton and lumber, to Savannah, now could "wagon" to the Rincon railhead for shipment.
